glsa.title: ncompress: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: compress and uncompress, which could be used by daemon programs, contain a buffer overflow that could lead to remote execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the daemon process.

background.p: ncompress is a utility handling compression and decompression of Lempel-Ziv archives, compatible with the original *nix compress and uncompress utilities (.Z extensions).

description.p: compress and uncompress do not properly check bounds on command line options, including the filename. Large parameters would trigger a buffer overflow.

impact.p: By supplying a carefully crafted filename or other option, an attacker could execute arbitrary code on the system. A local attacker could only execute code with his own rights, but since compress and uncompress are called by various daemon programs, this might also allow a remote attacker to execute code with the rights of the daemon making use of ncompress.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
